items.summary: Remove the free-text “Describe Your Dispute” chatbot experience from the “My Dispute – What Should I Do?” page, while keeping the category-selection experience as the only guidance workflow.

Expand the guidance content returned for each of the six fixed dispute categories in the category-selection tool to include substantially more specific, dispute-type-tailored information: (a) realistic examples, (b) mediation suitability guidance including when it may not be suitable, (c) clear next steps, (d) practical do’s and don’ts, and (e) legal-information notes written in plain English for India-focused context (informational, not legal advice).

Update backend dispute guidance structures and logic so the category-based guidance API can deliver the expanded guidance fields needed by the frontend, with category-specific tailored content (not the current generic step list).

Update the category-selection UI to present the new expanded guidance sections in a clear, scannable layout that remains mobile-friendly and accessible (e.g., headings, lists, and consistent spacing).
